it.polimi.se2018.utils

Class GameUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.utils.GameUtils

  • public class GameUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to create Game instances at different stages.

    The available stages are:

    • game set up
    • game started (turn not updated yet)
    • game started on first turn of round 1 with one die placed (single player only)
    • game at the end of a round
    • game finished
    Author:
    dvdmff

    • Method Detail

      • getSetUpGame

        public static Game getSetUpGame(boolean multiPlayer)
        Creates a fully set up game.

        In multi player mode, player one has private objective blue and player two has red; in single player mode player one has blue and red private objectives, in this order.

        All players have the dummy pattern "duomo" set as the sole candidate.

        Parameters:
        multiPlayer - true if in multi player mode.
        Returns:
        An instance of Game that is fully set up or null if some problem occurred.

      • getStartedGame

        public static Game getStartedGame(boolean multiPlayer)
        Creates an already started game.

        The game has the same setup as in getSetUpGame.

        All players have the dummy pattern "duomo" set as active pattern.

        Parameters:
        multiPlayer - true if in multi player mode.
        Returns:
        An instance of Game that is already started or null if some problem occurred.
        See Also:
        getSetUpGame(boolean)

      • getRoundFinishedGame

        public static Game getRoundFinishedGame(boolean multiPlayer)
        Creates a game that is at round one end.

        The game has the same setup as in getStartedGame.

        All players have the dummy pattern "duomo" set as active pattern.

        Parameters:
        multiPlayer - true if in multi player mode.
        Returns:
        An instance of Game that is at round one end or null if some problem occurred.
        See Also:
        getStartedGame(boolean)

      • getFinishedGame

        public static Game getFinishedGame(boolean multiPlayer)
        Creates an already finished game.

        The game has the same setup as in getStartedGame.

        All players have the dummy pattern "duomo" set as active pattern.

        Parameters:
        multiPlayer - true if in multi player mode.
        Returns:
        An instance of Game that is ended or null if some problem occurred.
        See Also:
        getStartedGame(boolean)

      • getHalfwayGame

        public static Game getHalfwayGame()
        Creates an already started game where a player has already placed one die.

        The placed die is a yellow 6 in position (1, 0).

        The game has the same setup as in getStartedGame.

        All players have the dummy pattern "duomo" set as active pattern.

        Returns:
        An instance of Game that is already started or null if some problem occurred.
        See Also:
        getStartedGame(boolean)

      • getDice

        public static java.util.List<Die> getDice(boolean multiPlayer)
        Returns a fixed list of dice.

        The dice are, in order

        • Red 1
        • Blue 4
        • Yellow 6
        • Red 2
        • Green 4 (if in multi player mode)

        All dice have been independently initialized with a random with seed 0, meaning that they have a well-known future set of values.

        Parameters:
        multiPlayer - true if in multi player mode.
        Returns:
        A list containing well-known dice.

      • getCompleteSinglePlayerGame

        public static Game getCompleteSinglePlayerGame(Game game)
        Creates a more complete game than the ones in GameUtils, with a real window pattern and 5 placed dice, but where the setUp is not done casually and it is easy to see how it should behave. (For single player configuration).

        The dice are chosen so that the sum of the values for each colour is always six, so that independently from the Private Objective chosen, the score related to it will always be 6. The PublicObjectiveCards are set for methods that don't need to calculate scores. The ones that need so must replace them with the XmlPublicObjectiveLoader.

        Parameters:
        game - the game to work on.
        Returns:
        the game
